overview: Sylvester Cat, Tweety Bird, and Hector the Bulldog are the pets of Granny, a gingerly matron with a penchant for solving mysteries. Granny is a Jessica Fletcher-like traveling detective who investigates disappearing objects and bizarre events at the four corners of the globe, while Sylvester constantly tries to grab and eat Tweety and is stopped by ever dutiful Hector, appointed Tweety's guardian by Granny.

episodes.title: The Cat Who Knew Too Much
episodes.description: In New Orleans, Granny and Tweety visit the annual canary crooning competition.

episodes.title: Platinum Wheel of Fortune
episodes.description: Granny investigates the theft of a one-of-a-kind platinum roulette wheel.

episodes.title: Double Take
episodes.description: Someone who looks and sounds like Granny is committing crimes in Denmark!

episodes.title: A Chip Off the Old Castle
episodes.description: The theft of the famous Blarney Stone brings Granny and company to County Cork, where they encounter the legendary Irish Banshee.

episodes.title: Something Fishy Around Here
episodes.description: When the worlds' largest tuna is kidnapped, Granny travels to Tokyo to find her.

episodes.title: B2 or Not B2
episodes.description: As Granny delivers a lecture aboard a luxury ocean liner, a series of vile, bingo-related mishaps occur.

episodes.title: Bull Running on Empty
episodes.description: Granny arrives in Pamplona, Spain, to find the thief who stole the priceless Pamplona Periscope.

episodes.title: A Ticket to Crime
episodes.description: Granny wins a trip to England, where she learns all the other great detectives in the world have won the same prize!

episodes.title: The Maltese Canary
episodes.description: In San Francisco, a host of shady characters mistake Tweety for the fabled "Maltese Canary."

episodes.title: It Happened One Night Before Christmas
episodes.description: Granny helps her absent-minded brother locate the $8,000 he misplaced in the town of Bedspread Falls on Christmas Eve.

episodes.title: Outback Down Under
episodes.description: Granny and her cohorts investigate when Australia's sheep population disappears.

episodes.title: It's a Plaid, Plaid, Plaid, Plaid World
episodes.description: Granny's cousin calls her to Scotland when the beloved McRory Tartan is stolen.

episodes.title: Go Fig
episodes.description: Rancher Sam Ficus summons Granny and company when his fig harvest vanishes.

episodes.title: Spaced Out
episodes.description: Touring Yosemite National Park, Granny, Tweety and Hector remain oblivious to an alien invasion.

episodes.title: Autumn's Leaving
episodes.description: Granny and the others encounter classic cartoon star Witch Hazel in a scary New England forest.

episodes.title: Catch as Catch Cannes
episodes.description: Granny investigates when the prizes at the James Caan Film Festival are stolen.

episodes.title: Yodel Recall
episodes.description: Granny must solve the mysterious kidnapping of the Von Trump family singers.

episodes.title: Don't Polka Me
episodes.description: Havoc ensues during the annual Polka Festival when someone replaces all the accordion reeds with duck calls.

episodes.title: The Granny Vanishes
episodes.description: Granny remains oblivious to a rash of disappearances on the Orient Express until she too is nowhere to be found.

episodes.title: The Scare Up There
episodes.description: Aboard a transcontinental airline flight, mischievous gnomes bedevil Sylvester.

episodes.title: If It's Wednesday, This Must Be Holland!
episodes.description: Granny bikes across much of Western Europe in pursuit of a brazen smuggler who has stolen some rare Blue Tulip bulbs.

episodes.title: Curse of De Nile
episodes.description: Granny, Sylvester and Tweety travel to Egypt to find the missing archaeologist Colonel Rimfire.

episodes.title: Hawaii 33 1/3
episodes.description: Granny, Sylvester and Tweety investigate the disappearance of Hawaiian Tiki statues.

episodes.title: Keep Your Pantheon
episodes.description: Sylvester steps back in time when he chases Tweety into Pandora's Box.

episodes.title: London Broiled
episodes.description: Granny becomes the next target for the Shripshire Slasher on a trip to London, England.

episodes.title: They Call Me Mr. Lincoln
episodes.description: Sylvester accidentally uses Abraham Lincoln's sacred toothpick and is forced to leave the state.

episodes.title: Froggone It
episodes.description: Granny and the gang investigate the kidnapping of singing toad Michigan J. Frog from Warner Bros. Studios.

episodes.title: One Froggy Throat
episodes.description: Sylvester becomes plagued by an opera singing toad.

episodes.title: Mush Ado About Nothing
episodes.description: Hector and Sylvester are forced to take turns as Granny's new sled dog.

episodes.title: The Star of Bombay
episodes.description: Granny, Sylvester and Tweety investigate a missing Indian film star.

episodes.title: Happy Pranksgiving
episodes.description: Granny and the gang try to find the "Sqeegee the Clown" parade balloon.

episodes.title: Is Paris Stinking?
episodes.description: French authorities ask Granny and the gang to find out what is causing a foul smell in the city.

episodes.title: Fangs for the Memories
episodes.description: Granny, Sylvester and Tweety take shelter in a spooky castle inhabited by a vampire.

episodes.title: Moscow Side Story
episodes.description: In Russia, Granny is hired to find the stolen Borscht Belt that if worn makes the wearer a comedian.

episodes.title: Fair's Fair
episodes.description: At the Idaho State Fair, Tweety finds suspicion in a bake-off.  The gang also tries to win first prize at the Idaho State Fair pie eating contest.

episodes.title: El Dia de los Pussygatos
episodes.description: Granny and the gang is asked to search for a missing mayor during Mexico's Day of the Dead celebration.

episodes.title: 3 Days & 2 Nights of the Condor
episodes.description: Beaky Buzzard hunts Tweety for his family's dinner.

episodes.title: Yelp
episodes.description: Granny and the gang look for a stolen diamond collar at an international dog show.

episodes.title: Jeepers Creepers
episodes.description: Granny tries to find missing jewels at a party.

episodes.title: Fleas Release Me
episodes.description: Granny and the gang must investigate the vanishing of performers at a flea circus.

episodes.title: Niagara's Fallen
episodes.description: Granny and the gang travel to Niagara Falls to see why the water is being diverted.

episodes.title: Spooker of the House
episodes.description: Howard Taft's ghost haunts Sylvester at the White House.

episodes.title: Furgo
episodes.description: Granny's former high school classmate appears in rural Minnesota.

episodes.title: The Fountain of Funk
episodes.description: Mysterious billionaire futurist Will Bates hires Granny to find the decade he lost in The Fountain Of Funk.

episodes.title: Yes, We Have No Canaries
episodes.description: A reclusive actor complains that all the native canaries have vanished from his island in Yes, We Have No Canaries.

episodes.title: The Shell Game
episodes.description: While sailing through exotic Galapagos Islands with Granny and Tweety on a ship, Sylvester falls overboard and is stranded on an island with Tweety where they meet Cecil Turtle.

episodes.title: Rasslin' Rhapsody
episodes.description: Granny accidentally gets tickets to "Rassle Mania" and is on the case when someone steals the championship belt; Sylvester winds up in the wrestling ring against The Crusher.

episodes.title: Ice Cat-Pades
episodes.description: Babbit and Catstello appear in this Canadian hockey mystery for Granny and the Gang to solve.

episodes.title: To Catch a Puddy
episodes.description: Sylvester is accidentally mistaken for a cat burglar.

episodes.title: Family Circles
episodes.description: Granny and the gang must find the source of mysterious crop circles.

episodes.title: Sea You Later
episodes.description: Renegade Manatees rampage against Lake Placid sea creatures.

episodes.title: A Case of Red Herring
episodes.description: Granny offers her help to a famous Swedish lawyer.

episodes.title: Roswell That Ends Well
episodes.description: An alien is missing in the New Mexico desert.

episodes.title: A Good Nephew is Hard to Find
episodes.description: Granny visits her nephew, Paul Freleng, in Tokyo.

episodes.title: Mirage Sale
episodes.description: Granny investigates the disappearance of a French Foreign Legion draftee.

episodes.title: The Stilted Perch
episodes.description: Granny, at a bed and breakfast, solves the disappearance of Flint Northwood, and encounter a magician criminal that the trio had recently put in jail.

episodes.title: A Game of Cat and Monster!
episodes.description: Granny searches for Colonel Rimfire in the Black Forest, and is captured by a mad scientist for Gossamer's dinner.

episodes.title: You're Thor?!
episodes.description: Vikings hire Granny to look for the golden statue of Thor.

episodes.title: I Gopher You
episodes.description: Granny investigates cattle rustling, which disturbs The Goofy Gophers.

episodes.title: Hold the Lyin' King, Please
episodes.description: Sylvester trades places with a lion.

episodes.title: Suite Mystery of Wife - At Last I Found You...
episodes.description: An Alfred Hitchcock mystery parody has Granny wondering if a mild-mannered scientist is harboring a secret, such as maybe bumping off his nagging wife.

episodes.title: The San Francisco Beat
episodes.description: When a San Francisco beatnik's magic flute disappears, Granny and the gang investigate.

episodes.title: Triangle of Terror
episodes.description: While Granny and her pets search for a Musical triangle for a conductor, Sylvester falls out of the plane and is stranded at sea.

episodes.title: Casino Evil
episodes.description: In Las Vegas, when Mr. Winner's albino monkey goes missing, Granny investigates and Sylvester performs in place of the monkey in its act.

episodes.title: Happy Bathday to You
episodes.description: Tweety celebrates his birthday at a birdbath factory in Bath, England. However, they become trapped inside the factory, and must find a way out.

episodes.title: The Rotha-Khan
episodes.description: In Mongolia, Sylvester accidentally breaks the cement footprints of town founder, Rotha Khan, landing Granny in jail. Sylvester and Hector encounter the mighty Rotha Khan in person.

episodes.title: Good Bird Hunting
episodes.description: Sylvester finds a long-lost ancient idol in South America, which makes him mighty and strong. Pete Puma pursues Tweety.

episodes.title: Feather Christmas
episodes.description: Spending the holidays in New England, Granny and the gang retrieve a little girl's bird that was delivered to a pet shop. Sylvester tries to be good, complaining that Santa Claus always gives him a rubber mouse (as he did in "Gift Wrapped").

episodes.title: A Fist Full of Lutefisk
episodes.description: In Trondheim, Norway, on New Year's Eve, Granny and her pets solve a mystery about a giant who is taking the town's lutefish.

episodes.title: The Fifty Karat Furball
episodes.description: Granny brings her pets along to a crime-solvers convention in Crimea where Rocky and Mugsy plan to steal the I of Istanbul which Sylvester accidentally swallows.

episodes.title: Venice, Anyone?
episodes.description: While vacationing at Venice, Italy, Granny, Sylvester and Tweety must find out who is behind the water disappearing.

episodes.title: Son of Roswell That Ends Well
episodes.description: While renting a relative's cottage for the summer, Granny gets mad when the satellite dish goes out and she and her pets go up in space to go get a general who has dog-like behavior.

episodes.title: A Mynah Problem
episodes.description: In New Zealand, Granny investigates the case about the missing Mynah Bird; Sylvester goes after the Mynah Bird and wants to eat it.

episodes.title: Whatever Happened to Shorty Twang?
episodes.description: Granny and the gang investigate the disappearance of a country singing star in Nashville.

episodes.title: A Big Knight Out
episodes.description: Granny, Sylvester, Tweety and Hector go to a medieval festival where someone has stolen King Arthur's stone that holds his sword.

episodes.title: Brussels Sprouts
episodes.description: Granny must find out who has taken the statue of Napoleon; Granny poses Hector as Napoleon to get the thieves.

episodes.title: The Golden Bird of Shangri-Claw
episodes.description: At Mount Everest, Granny investigates to see why it's no longer the tallest mountain in the world; Sylvester and Tweety fall down from Mount Everest and lands at "Shangri-Claw" where all the cats think Tweety is the golden bird.

episodes.title: When Granny Ruled the Earth
episodes.description: Granny, Sylvester, Tweety and Hector have ancestors in a documentary back in prehistoric times from 5 Billion BC to 5 Million BC.

episodes.title: Dutch Tweet
episodes.description: In Amsterdam, Granny is there to bid on a windmill figurine which has Rembrandt's famous night watch and loses her glasses and two thieves try to take the figurine for the night watch.

episodes.title: Bayou on the Half Shell
episodes.description: A giant crawdad is on the loose at the Bayou and Granny and Tweety are on the case; Hector and Sylvester are put in obedience school.

episodes.title: Seeing Double
episodes.description: Granny, Sylvester, Tweety and Hector go to "Happy Pet Village" for a tour. Meanwhile, Tweety meets Orson, and they both drive Sylvester crazy and confused.

episodes.title: This is The Kitty
episodes.description: Granny narrates and is a souvenir volunteer at the city zoo while Sylvester is trying to pursue Tweety who lets a Jack Webb-like detective and animals get in his way. You can see Sylvester's green brain with yellow tentacles that Hector is holding when he does not spit out Tweety.

episodes.title: Eye for an Aye Aye
episodes.description: In Madagascar, Granny and the gang are in a souvenir shop and discovers Captain Kidd's missing treasure map and they go treasure-hunting for it while Yosemite Sam and his lemur crew try to get it for themselves.

episodes.title: When Harry Met Salieri
episodes.description: In Vienna, Austria, Granny, Sylvester and Tweety investigate ghosts that are stealing the sound of music.

episodes.title: The Early Woim Gets the Boid
episodes.description: While in Seoul, Korea, Granny's old friend, Mr. Kim who owns a silk factory, discovers his worms are disappearing and only has one more left and Granny leaves Sylvester to watch it so nothing happens.

episodes.title: Blackboard Jumble
episodes.description: Sylvester and Hector face against each other in a battle of blackboard brouhaha.

episodes.title: What's the Frequency, Kitty?
episodes.description: Sylvester runs from an overly-friendly ghost named Spooky in a mansion.

episodes.title: Dial V for Veterinarian
episodes.description: Granny takes her pets to the veterinarian.

episodes.title: California's Crusty Bronze
episodes.description: A restaurant in Los Angeles is under threat, so Granny tries to solve who is ruining the restaurant's reputation.

episodes.title: The Tail End
episodes.description: Scientists at the Manx Institute have developed a Manx mouse -- and it's missing!  Everyone suspects Sylvester. Can Granny solve the case?

episodes.title: This is the End
episodes.description: Sylvester finally eats Tweety. How will this effect the show? Well, apparently, this means no more episodes!
